alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 02 at 6:50PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MST/945 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. However, only light showers remain south of Pinon. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona from approximately Seba Dalkai to just south of Pinon within Navajo County. * WHEN...Until 845 PM MST /945 PM MDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Ponding of water on interstates, highways and in urban areas will create hazardous travel conditions. Unimproved roads may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 648 PM MST /748 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Tse Chizzi Wash, Little Colorado River, Tees Toh Wash, Ha- whi-yalin Wash, Burnt Corn Wash, Coyote Wash, Bluebird Canyon Wash, Keams Canyon Wash, Wepo Wash, Jeddito Wash and Polacca Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Seba Dalkai, Tees Toh, Cedar Springs, First Mesa, Polacca, Hopi Reservation and Navajo Reservation. - This includes the following highways... State Route 264 between mile markers 386 and 403. State Route 87 between mile markers 374 and 401. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
